[Section 50](https://pdg.lbl.gov/2024/reviews/rpp2024-rev-resonances.pdf) in the PDG [@ParticleDataGroup:2024cfk] provides an overview of scattering theory and resonance parametrizations. @Aitchison:1972ay first introduced the $K$-matrix formalism and @chungPrimerKmatrixFormalism1995, @Chung:1995dx, @Bargiotti:2002ric, and @Peters:2004qw provide a comprehensive review of the formalism.

The Chewâ€“Mandelstam function for $S$&nbsp;waves is described in @Basdevant:1977ya, [Equation (3.8)](https://journals.aps.org/prd/pdf/10.1103/PhysRevD.16.657#page=6). It also discusses background unitarization, see [Equation (3.5)](https://journals.aps.org/prd/pdf/10.1103/PhysRevD.16.657#page=5). A great introduction to unitarity, analyticity and crossing symmetry can be found by @Aitchison:2015jxa.

Some great examples of coupled analyses with the $K$-matrix formalism are @Anisovich:2002ij and @CrystalBarrel:2019zqh.
